intro: Boscia filipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved boschia, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by small, round fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Boscia filipes is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
